messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] opera for kids
messages.msgSnippet: We took a video of the Magic Flute from the library in German and 3 and a half hours long about 4 months ago and we are still singing parts of it.  It is
messages.messageBody:
We took a video of the Magic Flute from the library in German and 3 and
a half hours long about 4 months ago and we are still singing parts of
it. It is fantastic. Lisa of MT

-----Original Message-----
From: Lisa Anselmo [mailto:lanselmo3@...]
Sent: Friday, December 06, 2002 3:21 PM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] opera for kids

We have a great opera tape for kids called "Classical Child at the
Opera". It has selections from The Magic Flute, Hansel and
Gretel, Barber of Seville, etc., all sung in English. We also love
The Classical Kids tape "The Magic Flute".

Lisa, mom to Nick, 8

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] opera for kids
messages.msgSnippet: ... Oh yes.  Lars liked all the Classical Kids tapes when he was little.  There are tapes about Bach, Beethoven, Vivaldi, Handel, Tchaikovsky, and the Magic
messages.messageBody:
>
> > We have a great opera tape for kids called "Classical Child at the
> > Opera"

Oh yes. Lars liked all the Classical Kids tapes when he was little. There
are tapes about Bach, Beethoven, Vivaldi, Handel, Tchaikovsky, and the Magic
Flute. I guess there are probably a bunch more since he lost interest. Now
that I'm thinking of it, I should pass those tapes on to my daughter for her
kids.
Tia

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] opera for kids

> We have a great opera tape for kids called "Classical Child at the

thanks, Lisa, we'll look for it!

Elizabeth
